messages.content: In Portsmouth South, we will have a new MP. No other candidate is going to win. Working as part of our local team alongside councillors and campaigners, we've secured funding for schools and are fighting cuts to local charities. I want you to vote for Suzy Horton as your councillor on Thursday. Your vote has never been more important. Please support me to protect our NHS and deliver a positive vision for Portsmouth South.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Secured funding of £6 million for Bramble Infant School and campaigning for fairer parking and fighting the £50,000 Conservative cuts to local charities.
Secured funding for extra 1,000 primary school places.
Started building council housing in the city for the first time in a generation.
Fought to keep the Royal Navy's carriers in the dockyard, guaranteeing jobs up to the city for the next 40 years.

mentions.tacticalSituation: A vote for UKIP, Labour or the Greens will just help the Conservatives sneak in by the back door. I'm the only candidate that can stop the Conservatives here.

issues.education: Secured funding for extra 1,000 primary school places.

housing.content: Started building council housing in the city for the first time in a generation.

leaflet.personalStatement: I believe that I have the track record and experience of working hard for local people.

politicalExperience.achievements: Ran the City Council for a decade.

images.caption: Image of a letter from Gerald Vernon-Jackson addressed to a constituent.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet includes a personal note and signature from Gerald Vernon-Jackson, encouraging the recipient to vote for Suzy Horton as a councillor on Thursday.
